p: Alternatively, a virtual screening of FDA-approved drugs was performed against the SARS-CoV-2 Mpro, giving the glecaprevir and maraviroc as the best inhibitors [143]. Further, also selected anti-HIV drugs ( e.g., saquinavir, ritonavir, lopinavir, and others) and anti-HCV drugs ( e.g., simeprevir, faldaprevir, and asunaprevir) were docked against SARS-CoV-2 Mpro. Indeed, simeprevir ( Fig. 7D), an approved HCV NS3/4A protease inhibitor, seems to be a promising lead compound, fitting quite well (-10.0Â kcal/mol) in two hydrophobic pockets flanking the catalytic dyad dyad His41-Cys145 and inducing an opening of the substrate binding pocket, which weakens significantly the compactness of the active site [144].
